title: Riot continues to ignore Muramana when the only champ who uses it is EZ.....
body:
{{champion:6}} no longer uses it after rework
{{champion:83}} no longer uses it after rework
{{champion:126}} does more damage from lethality and is no longer mana gated.

Besides no one really using the item, there has been several threads pointing out why the item is in a terrible state.

1... there aren't many AD/mana items to synergies with muramana.
2...takes for ever to stack.
3....the damage isn't worth the investment. Crit and lethality outscales muramana hard.
4....AD champs in general don't need mana anymore.
5....Does less damage the more it drains mana.

After all this, riot continues to ignore the item.

Why do you remove items like Zephyr or DFG but not Ohmwrecker and Manamune anyway? Do you have plans in stored for them soon(tm)?

It's a consideration to make on a case by case basis, honestly.

Removing DFG from the shop (though I wasn't on the team years ago when that decision was made) does seem like the right call to me.

As to Zephyr, it seems like it wasn't earning its place in the shop, and that's a very similar space for Ohmwrecker and Manamune. If Zephyr were still in the game today, I'm not sure there would be a good reason to remove it and not Ohmwrecker, for example. That said, we wouldn't really gain a whole lot by reintroducing it either. The difference to me between Zephyr and Manamune is perhaps that the fantasy behind Manamune is a lot more compelling and defined, perhaps, but that's a pretty subjective assessment.
well if ADC damage will get nerfed and tanks won't be too op to tank tower 24/7. {{item:3056}}  will have more attention.

Ohmwrecker was introduced when towers were still good and nobody picked it up then.

It’s a fundamentally bad item.

Its a fundementally bad item as long as it is a TANK item.  Because they already don't care about towers generally by the first completed item, so why build an item to turn them off?

You know who would most benefit from Ohm Wrecker?  Assassins looking for dive openings, and are willing to give up some damage for the tower to be a non-factor.  It could also be a fitting Inspiration Keystone that uses the boot enchant method to make it something we can activate when we want it, so that anyone who wants to opt into diving could do so at the cost of the keystone.  Imagine if a jungler could opt to give up their keystone, but after their first back in the jungle could turn off a tower once every 2-3 minutes?  Perhaps even make it a Keystone enchant that makes ANY objective in the area go into stasis for ~5 seconds or so.  Turn off an enemy tower for a dive?  Sure.  Protect an allied tower for 5 seconds so that we can clear the minion wave so they can't get much damage on it, compared to killing it?  Sure.   Notice that the enemy is doing Baron, and you JUST are too far to reach it in time?  Gotcha covered.  Perhaps the enemy jungle is going to try and contest that dragon, and are just about to blast cone over the pit?   Would be a damned shame if the Dragon was suddenly stasised for 5 seconds now wouldn't it?

This would fit perfectly as an Inspiration keystone, without making it something that may be must take or not, and makes it something you can opt into as any champ, not just a tank or perhaps a tanky support.

the problem with giving it to an assassin is that towers are supposed to be soft counters to their playstyle. Ohmwrecker on a damage class would be oppressive on splitpushing assassins (or Tryndamere) unless you gave them stats they didn’t want (basically pay for the active)

Bearing that in mind, it doesn’t even work because the effect is kinda negliable when factoring in dives anyways. Allies don’t really notice or appreciate the effect either (say if you wanted to initate a dive and this item signals that) to matter. It’s kinda like using Bard’s ult on an enemy turret - very rarely pays off or was necessary.

Which is exactly why I think it is a very fitting Inspiration Keystone.

If an assassin opts into it, they are giving up Electrocute/Dark Harvest, and double-damage primary/secondary runes, for Inspiration's utility effects as their primary tree.   That is a MASSIVE cost.

At that point, they are paying the price.

As for tower disables, the problem is the class that can get it is the one class that least cares about it.  Bard can also do so with his ult, but it has a risk attached of the enemy trying to make use of the Stasis to hide out the dive and then outplay with the tower back up, or some other negative from his ult just because of how his ult is.
Towers were never super scary though.

The 'fantasy' of Manamune? What do you mean? If you're talking about charging up an item to gain power later, we have {{item:3040}} /{{item:3027}} . If you're talking about a legendary sword, we have {{item:3031}} .

Manamune is from a different time, before Riot randomly decided that AD champions didn't need restrictive mana costs after laning phase anymore and they cut down on the mana costs of every AD champion except {{champion:126}} {{champion:81}} and{{champion:11}} . And since then, Jayce has had his mana costs lowered, Yi has FINALLY had his mana costs lowered, and Ezreal...Meddler mentioned that Ezreal really needs a new W like a year ago, but nothing has been done about that. 

What fantasy does Manamune describe that isn't satisfied by {{item:3508}} ?

I would have a lot more fun playing AD champs if there was an AD mana item that didn't completely hobble their power curve. For example, if you buy a Tear on ADs like Illaoi or MF, they play a lot more like a battle/mage, which is a lot of fun. Right now that's always a disastrous choice, but I think it would be nice if Muramana existed in a form that enabled that option with either a less crippling early tradeoff or a more rewarding payoff.

Ah, now I have something to go off of. Personally, I feel like the time it takes to stack it is the biggest problem it has for certain champions, but reducing the time it takes to stack would make other champions a problem. I'm not sure how they could get around that since they already have a limit on how often you can get mana etc.

What if they were to do something like RoA where it will stack indefinitely over a set amount of time? Then again, that could become a problem since they'd most likely change archangels to match it, which could cause a lot of problems (mages becoming more OP).

It also doesn't give you that much AD, but I think that's because of Muramana's passive when it's fully stacked, but it gets progressively weaker the more you attack. If they were able to figure out a way to increase the rate at which it stacks for certain champions while also increasing the amount of AD it gave, it might be a more lucrative pick.
